11 Parameterization To show that I can work with parameterization in my Markdowns, I made a parameterized markdown with data about COVID-19 cases and COVID-19 related deaths. The data used for this markdown was from the ECDC website. To start, I downloaded this data from the website and read it in in RStudio. covid19_data <- read_csv(here::here("Data/Data_raw/covid19_data.csv")) Then, I stored the three parameters as objects so I can use them in the title of my figures. I also changed the value ‘month’ to a numeric variable, so it’d be easier to use later on in the graphs. covid19_data <- covid19_data %>% mutate(month = month.name[as.numeric(month)]) country <- params$country year <- params$year months <- params$month # covid19_data_filtered <- covid19_data %>% filter(year %in% params$year, month %in% params$month, countriesAndTerritories %in% params$country) I created a graph to show the COVID-19 cases per day for a specific month, and I also created a graph for the amount of COVID-19 related deaths per day for a specific month. covid19_data %>% group_by(day, month, year) %>% filter(countriesAndTerritories == params$country & year == params$year & month == params$month) %>% ggplot(aes(x = day, y = cases)) + geom_point() + scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1, 31, 1)) + labs(title = paste0("COVID-19 cases in ", country, ", ", months, " ", year), x = "Day", y = "COVID-19 cases") covid19_data %>% group_by(day, month, year) %>% filter(countriesAndTerritories == params$country & year == params$year & month == params$month) %>% ggplot(aes(x = day, y = deaths)) + geom_point() + scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1, 31, 1)) + labs(title = paste0("COVID-19 related deaths in ", country, ", ", months, " ", year), x = "Day" , y = "COVID-19 related deaths") I made three HTML’s with rmarkdown::render() in R. For a parameterized HTML on the COVID-19 cases and deaths in Ireland, August 2020, click here For a parameterized HTML on the COVID-19 cases and deaths in Belgium, April 2021, click here For a parameterized HTML on the COVID-19 cases and deaths in Austria, February 2022, click here
